title: U.S. Department of Health & Human Services (HHS) Office for Civil Rights (OCR) / MEDEIROS (Department of Health and Human Services)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request

Date: February 7, 2025

To:
U.S. Department of Health & Human Services (HHS)
Office for Civil Rights (OCR)
ATTN: FOIA Officer
JFK Federal Building, Room 1875
Boston, MA 02203
Fax: (617) 565-3809

Subject: FOIA Request for All Records Related to OCR Transaction No. 01-25-595812
Dear FOIA Officer,

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I am requesting copies of all records, communications, internal memos, and related documents associated with the review and closure of my civil rights complaint filed with the U.S. Department of Health & Human Services (HHS) Office for Civil Rights (OCR), Transaction No. 01-25-595812.

1. Scope of Request
I am specifically requesting:

All internal communications (emails, memos, notes, reports, and case evaluations) related to OCR’s review and determination of my complaint.
All correspondence between OCR staff, including but not limited to Laurie Senat, Barbara C. Stampul, Pam Bindi, and any other officials involved in the case review and closure.
Any legal analyses or justifications used to support the decision to close my complaint without further investigation.
All case file documentation, including investigative records, reports, and any documents submitted by third parties.
Records of any communications or directives from HHS leadership regarding how complaints such as mine are handled or prioritized.

2. Request for Expedited Processing
Given the civil rights implications of this case, I request expedited processing under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E). The release of these records is in the public interest, as it pertains to the enforcement of federal civil rights laws, ADA compliance, and government transparency regarding critical healthcare and human services protections.

3. Request for Fee Waiver
I request a fee waiver pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii), as the requested information is sought in the public interest and is not for commercial use. The requested records will contribute significantly to public understanding of government operations, civil rights enforcement, and HHS compliance practices.

4. Format of Response
I request that responsive records be provided electronically in PDF format via email or secure digital link. If any portion of the requested records is exempt from disclosure, please provide a detailed index justifying each exemption under Vaughn v. Rosen, 484 F.2d 820 (D.C. Cir. 1973).

5. Legal Obligation to Respond
Per 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i), you are required to respond to this request within 20 business days. If you require additional time, please provide a detailed written explanation for the delay.


Failure to comply with this request in a timely manner may result in further legal and administrative action to enforce compliance with FOIA. I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources
Whistleblower & Advocate for Constitutional Rights

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

DAVID MEDEIROS

title: Public Records Request for Body Cam Footage – Deltona Middle School Arrest

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request for Body Cam Footage – Deltona Middle School Arrest
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to all available body camera footage related to the arrest of Jorge Rivera and Dagmarie Aponte Iturrino at Deltona Middle School on November 19, 2024.

To assist in locating the footage, here are the details of the incident:

- Date of Event: November 19, 2024
- Location: Deltona Middle School, Deltona, Florida
- Arresting Agency: Volusia County Sheriff’s Office
- Involved Deputy: School Resource Officer (female deputy)
Suspects:
- Jorge Rivera (46 years old)
- Dagmarie Aponte Iturrino (45 years old)
Incident Description:
-  The parents arrived at Deltona Middle School to protest their son being charged with battery for pushing a classmate.
- Jorge Rivera allegedly became irate during the meeting with the school resource officer, yelling insults and refusing to leave when asked.
- While in the school hallway, Dagmarie Aponte Iturrino allegedly shoved the officer, and Jorge Rivera then punched the officer in the face.
- The officer attempted to use a Taser but was knocked to the ground during the altercation.
- Jorge Rivera allegedly took the officer’s Taser before both suspects were subdued and arrested.
- The deputy sustained a concussion and was treated at a hospital.
Charges:
- Battery on a law enforcement officer
- Resisting with violence
- Disruption of a school function
- Trespassing on school grounds
- Armed robbery and grand theft (Jorge Rivera only, for taking the deputy’s Taser)
I am requesting any body camera footage related to this incident, including:

1. The initial interaction between the deputy and the parents inside the school.
2. The altercation in the hallway and subsequent struggle.
3. The arrest and any relevant post-arrest footage.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Request for Body Cam Footage – Child Neglect Arrest in Doral, FL (June 2024)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage – Child Neglect Arrest in Doral, FL (June 2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to the body camera footage from an incident that occurred in June 2024 in Doral, Florida, involving the arrest of a woman identified as Renteria for allegedly leaving her 3-year-old son unattended in a vacation rental while undergoing plastic surgery.

To assist in locating the footage, here are the details of the incident:

title: paragon

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: paragon
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The requested records are those, for the period between January 1, 2022 and the date on which this request is processed, describing and relating to the relationship between this agency and Paragon Solutions and any relationships between any representative of either entity.
Responsive records include, but are not limited to, documents concerning or mentioning Paragon Solutions and any representative thereof, including all documentation regarding its Graphite platform and any other service or software provided by or created by Paragon Solutions. These include, but are not limited to, the following:
CONTRACT AND AGREEMENTS
• All contracts, memorandums of understanding, and any other written agreements between this agency and Paragon Solutions, including all associated amendments, exhibits, and supplemental and supporting documentation. More information about the contract in question can be found here: https://www.usaspending.gov/award/CONT_AWD_70CTD024P00000012_7012_-NONE-_-NONE-. 
FINANCIAL MATERIALS
• All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations related to the relationship between the aforementioned entities. Responsive materials include all invoices, bills, receipts, check stubs, or any other records, including those possessed in an electronic format. This also includes any Requests for Proposal and bidding materials provided by Paragon Solutions and any other entities responding to the same Request for Proposal or equivalent procurement request.
DOCUMENTATION OF USE
• Any logs of use and other data obtained from the Paragon Solutions platform. Should query logs exist for any other platform, service, or software created and/or provided by Paragon Solutions, these materials are also responsive to this request.
• Any audits and reports of audits of use of Paragon Solutions platforms

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Cooper Quintin

title: US Navy support for 2025 film "Captain America: Brave New World"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: US Navy support for 2025 film "Captain America: Brave New World"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to collaboration between the U.S. Navy and the production of the 2025 movie "Captain America: Brave New World," directed by Julius Onah and starring Harrison Ford and Liv Tyler. I request any and all documents pertaining to Navy support for "Captain America: Brave New World." Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of the Navy and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Captain America: Brave New World," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

communications.subject: Your verification code
communications.communication: Your confirmation code is 039058

communications.subject: Navy FOIA Request 2025-NavyFOIA-003907 - Acknowledgment
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Carollo: 

The Department of the Navy received your Freedom of Information (FOIA) / Privacy Act (PA) request dated February 5, 2025, and placed it in queue for processing by order of receipt on the same day. 

Unusual circumstances arise when a response within the statutory 20-day period may not be attainable due to: 

1. Collection and search for records from a facility outside of this office. 
2. Volume of records that may be responsive to your request. 
3. Consultation with one or more agencies having a substantial interest in the determination or the subject matter. 

The Navy FOIA program is decentralized, requiring our office to search and gather documents from Navy component offices which are not geographically co-located. Per the Department of the Navy FOIA/PA regulation 32 CFR §701.8(g)(2), this office grants itself an extension of ten days response time. We appreciate your patience and understand the importance of timely responses to FOIA requests and apologize for any inconvenience this delay may cause. 

Additionally, please be aware that the U.S. Navy’s new FOIA portal, Secure Release, is online. For your convenience, you may now submit FOIA requests online at www.SecureRelease.us or www.FOIA.gov. 

Please direct questions to the FOIA Service Center by phone (202) 685-0412 or send via email don-foia-pa@us.navy.mil. 

U.S. Navy Headquarters (FOIA) 
2000 Navy Pentagon 
Washington, DC 20350-1200 
don-foia-pa@us.navy.mil

title: Communications concerning California ID cards

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Communications concerning California ID cards
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all communications concerning the California ID Card program between employees of the California DMV and federal agencies, including but not limited to Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) and Border Patrol. This request should not be understood to be seeking personally identifiable information of ID holders. The date range for this request is from Oct. 1, 2024, to the present.

Please include any relevant emails, memos, reports, or other forms of communication that pertain to this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Cory Dawson

communications.subject: REQ-2025-2211
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Dawson,

DMV acknowledges receipt of your request received on February 5, 2025.

I am writing to request clarification on your request. There may be some confusion about your request regarding the California ID Card program.

The CAL ID program is a program that exist to give ex-inmates an ID card upon release, however you have included ICE and Border Patrol in your list of federal agencies . Are you asking for communications regarding the inmate ID card program or for communications regarding AB 1766, also known as the "CA ID for All?"

Thank you.


[cid:image001.png@01DB77DA.86218080]
Jae Ahn | Attorney
Legal Affairs Division
California Department of Motor Vehicles
O: 916.657.6469 |

Confidentiality Notice: This e-mail message, including any attachments, is for the sole use of the intended recipient(s) and may contain confidential and privileged information. Any unauthorized review, use, disclosure or distribution is prohibited.  If you are not the intended recipient, please contact the sender by reply e-mail and destroy all copies of the original message.

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: Communications concerning California ID cards
communications.communication:
Dear Jae Ahn, 

Thank you for your prompt reply and for this clarification request. You are correct, this request is concerning communications concerning CA ID for All. 

Thanks again for your work and attention to this matter. 

All the best,
Cory Dawson

communications.subject: Open Records Request :: W673087-020525
communications.communication:
Dear Cory Dawson: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of the City of San Antonio. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with Chapter 552 of  the Texas Government Code, known as the Public Information Act. Your request was received in this office on 2/5/2025 and given the reference number W673087-020525 for tracking purposes. 
 
 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant City department(s). You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. 
 
In accordance with the Public Information Act, Chapter 552 of the Texas Government Code, the City of San Antonio makes all of its public records available to citizens. 
 
The Public Information Act does not require governmental bodies to create new information, perform legal research, or to answer questions. The request must ask for records or information already in existence. The City of San Antonio will not comply with a standing request for information to be collected or prepared in the future. 
 
The City of San Antonio will respond within ten business days following submission of requests.  The City of San Antonio may collect a fee as prescribed by law for the requested documents. For more information on the Texas Public Information Act, please visit the Texas Attorney General Web site at www.oag.state.tx.us 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Open Records Center. 
 SA Open Records

City of San Antonio

title: George W. Bush Library: Lou Pearlman Documents

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: George W. Bush Library: Lou Pearlman Documents
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents related to boy band empresario Lou Pearlman. A recent Netflix special included the assertion that in the immediate aftermath of 9/11, Pearlman was able to directly call President Bush in order to clear Pearlman's private plane to fly. 



News coverage of the Netflix special described this Pearlman/Bush connection as: 

"However, his (Pearlman's) connections were so significant that he called President George W. Bush to request special permission to allow the members of Natural to fly. Not only did President Bush grant special permission, but he also sent special planes to pick them up in New York. Lou Pearlman was so powerful that he could bypass strict national laws for his personal benefit. Pearlman quite literally defied the attacks on September 11, 2001—not even something as severe as that could stand in his way."

Here's a link to news coverage of the Netflix special:

https://screenrant.com/netflix-dirty-pop-boy-band-scam-documentary-shocking-reveals/

If any such documents exist, this is a request for:

Any correspondence between Lou Pearlman and President Bush 
Any correspondence from Governor Jeb Bush that mentions Pearlman 
Any record of a phone call between Pearlman and Bush in the aftermath of 9/11
Any record of President Bush's effort to assist Pearlman's flight
Any photographs of Pearlman and President Bush or Laura Bush together 

Thank you for the Bush library's commitment to transparency, and I look forward to working with you on this request until it reaches resolution.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: Obama Library: NSC Correspondence Related to May 2013 "Drone Playbook" Fact Sheet

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Obama Library: NSC Correspondence Related to May 2013 "Drone Playbook" Fact Sheet
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All information, analyses, summaries, assessments, email threads, or similar records included in National Security Correspondence related to the drafting of the May 2013 publication on the Whitehouse.gov website of a "drone playbook fact sheet." The formal name of this document is: "U.S. Policy Standards and Procedures for the Use of Force in Counterterrorism Operations Outside of the United States and Areas of Active Hostilities." This document was a carefully crafted public statement regarding drone use by the Obama administration. Please be sure to include a search of pre-publication emails that transmitted all fact sheet drafts (including as attachments) before it was published. 

An archived version of this document is located at: https://web.archive.org/web/20130525000828/https://www.whitehouse.gov/sites/default/files/uploads/2013.05.23_fact_sheet_on_ppg.pdf
News media coverage of controversies surrounding the release of this playbook can be easily found online: https://www.politico.eu/article/obama-to-release-drone-playbook/

In order to limit the scope of this request, please limit the time range for relevant documents from January 20th 2009 until the date in May 2013 when the fact sheet was published. In order to expedite this request, documents related to the 2013 to 2016 battle to release the "Presidential Policy Guidance (PPG)" memo need NOT be part of this request. 

Thank you for the Obama Presidential Library's commitment to transparency, and I look forward to working with you towards resolving this request

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: SoMa West Community Benefit District

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: SoMa West Community Benefit District
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The SoMa West CBD was established in 2019, as of 2020-21 had an annual assessment of $3,859,195.14, and runs a Safety Ambassador Security Task Force:
https://sfmayor.org/article/mayor-london-breed-signs-legislation-establishing-soma-west-community-benefit-district
https://somawestcbd.org/
https://www.sf.gov/file/2022-san-francisco-property-business-improvement-district-pbid-program-impact-analysis
https://somawestcbd.org/post/safety-ambassadors-meet-and-greet-at-decant-sf

I request the following records:

1) Budget and annual financial statements for FY2023, FY2024, FY2025 and FY2026. This includes any documents (including but not limited to PDF, word processing, excel, and slide documents) related to the association's budget and financial statements, including both unaudited and audited statements, accounts receivable, balance sheets, revenue & expense statements, cashflow statements, annual financial audits, and any other financial planning documents. This also includes any information about financial reserve planning.

2) Any documents (including but not limited to PDF, word processing, excel, and slide documents) including contracts, purchase orders, invoices, financial plans, and financial reports related to the operations of the Safety Ambassador Security Task Force, since January 1 2023. This includes any documents about the purchase and maintenance of vehicles and staffing costs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Maya Kaczorowski

communications.communication:
Greetings,
This message is to confirm that we have received your Records Request dated February 5, 2025.
You have requested the following records:
1) Budget and annual financial statements for FY2023, FY2024, FY2025 and FY2026. This includes any documents (including but not limited to PDF, word processing, excel, and slide documents) related to the association's budget and financial statements, including both unaudited and audited statements, accounts receivable, balance sheets, revenue & expense statements, cashflow statements, annual financial audits, and any other financial planning documents. This also includes any information about financial reserve planning.
2) Any documents (including but not limited to PDF, word processing, excel, and slide documents) including contracts, purchase orders, invoices, financial plans, and financial reports related to the operations of the Safety Ambassador Security Task Force, since January 1 2023. This includes any documents about the purchase and maintenance of vehicles and staffing costs.
Our department will conduct a search, compile and release any responsive records identified related to the requested information. The Sunshine Ordinance requires departments to respond as soon as possible or within 10 calendar days from receipt of any records requests.
Therefore, we will contact you on or before February 17, 2025, as permitted by San Francisco Administrative Code § 67.21(b) and California Government Code § 7922.535.
Sincerely,
The Office of Economic and Workforce Development

title: 2024 BPD Budget

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: 2024 BPD Budget
communications.communication:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

The budget and actual spending of the Boston Police Department between January 1, 2024 and December 31, 2024 which fall under the following titles : “special events”, “central booking”, ”central lockup”, “regional lockup”, or “central booking transfers” or any which fall under costs related to the MEMORANDUM OF AGREEMENT FOR DETENTION OF ARRESTEES AT THE SUFFOLK COUNTY JAIL signed by the Suffolk County Sheriff's Department and the Boston Police Department.  

I also request the budget and expenditure to staff central booking facilities, as well as any and all payments made to the Suffolk sheriff’s department between January 1, 2024 and December 31, 2024.  

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

communications.subject: Police Records Request :: B000357-020525
communications.communication:
Dear Michael Lozada 
Thank you for your interest in public records of Boston Police Department. Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on 2/5/2025 10:50:36 PM and given the reference number B000357-020525 for tracking purposes. 
If this is a media request, please contact the Office of Media Relations directly at 617.343.4520. 
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

The budget and actual spending of the Boston Police Department between January 1, 2024 and December 31, 2024 which fall under the following titles : “special events”, “central booking”, ”central lockup”, “regional lockup”, or “central booking transfers” or any which fall under costs related to the MEMORANDUM OF AGREEMENT FOR DETENTION OF ARRESTEES AT THE SUFFOLK COUNTY JAIL signed by the Suffolk County Sheriff's Department and the Boston Police Department.

I also request the budget and expenditure to staff central booking facilities, as well as any and all payments made to the Suffolk sheriff’s department between January 1, 2024 and December 31, 2024.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael Lozada

title: Communications concerning Enhanced Library Card

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Communications concerning Enhanced Library Card
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all communications concerning the Austin Public Library's Enhanced Library Card program between employees of the City of Austin and federal agencies, including but not limited to Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) and Border Patrol. This request should not be understood to be seeking personally identifiable information of ID holders. The date range for this request is from Oct. 1, 2024, to the present.

Please include any relevant emails, memos, reports, or other forms of communication that pertain to this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Cory Dawson
